content.question: A laser beam of wavelength <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math> is incident on two narrow, parallel slits. A pattern of alternating bright and dark fringes appears on a distant screen, as shown in the figure. The screen is a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the slits, and the center-to-center distance between the two bright fringes indicated is <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>, where <math alttext="x is much smaller than D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>≪</mo><mi>D</mi></math>. How far apart are the two slits from each other?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction lambda D over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="2 times the fraction lambda D over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="3 times the fraction lambda D over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="4 times the fraction lambda D over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
